alert.note: Alert for Boise (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 7:33PM MDT until May 04 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch affecting Boise County. .Warm temperatures through Thursday will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Payette River...including Lowman, Crouch, Emmett, Payette... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.8 feet, Low-lying areas near the intersection of Banks-Lowman Road and Middle Fork Road will be impacted by floodwaters. Water will encroach on Weilmunster Park and the Garden Valley Trail. The river will be out of its banks and impact adjacent lowlands from Crouch upriver past Elk Springs Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 05/21/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 245 PM MDT.
